full_summary:
### Correctional Training Program (CTP) - Accommodations Solicitation

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a contractor to provide accommodation services for the Correctional Training Program (CTP) in the Pacific Region. The program is scheduled to take place from November 6, 2023, to May 29, 2024, with optional two six-month extensions.

The Contractor will be responsible for providing accommodation and breakfast meals for up to four (4) CTP groups, with a maximum of twenty-four (24) recruits per group. The Contractor's facilities must be located within twenty (20) kilometers of #103 – 30585B Progressive Way, Abbotsford, BC, V2T 6W3.

The Contractor must provide single occupancy rooms with a private washroom, mini-refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave. The room must have a double size bed, desk with chair, alarm clock, a closet, and a television with free local channels.

The Contractor must also provide on-site laundry facilities, parking, and access to a gym, health facility, or pool. Breakfast meals must be provided seven (7) days a week, with a minimum of twenty-four (24) hours notice for cancellations.

The Contractor must have a Point of Contact (POC) on-site to provide customer service, twenty-four (24) hours a day, seven (7) days a week. The Contractor must also have protocols in place for responding to COVID-19 related issues and provide breakfast meals to recruits who are in self-isolation.

The estimated quantity of commodity is based on the solicitation document statement of work and basis of payment. The duration of the contract is from November 6, 2023, to May 29, 2024, with optional two six-month extensions.

### Important Information

*   The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
*   Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).
*   After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.
